message.content:
cs.DC, cs.PL, cs.SE, cs.DS, cs.SY. 

The paper discusses a new paradigm for cloud computing, specifically aimed at simplifying the programming of cloud applications. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a formal programming model for serverless computing, which combines ideas from both the $\lambda$-calculus (for functions) and the $\pi$-calculus (for communication). This suggests that the paper may also belong to the Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-category. The paper also discusses limitations of current vendor technologies and proposes possible amendments, which suggests that the paper may belong to the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category. Finally, the paper models a real-world serverless system, which suggests that the paper may also belong to the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) and Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-categories.
